results.title: The Seventh Enemy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Everyman”.
Based on the book of the same title the six elements in the global crisis are explained: The population explosion, starvation, disappearing natural resources, degradation of the environment, nuclear weapons and the power of science and technology. The real danger is the seventh enemy - the human factor of apathy and inertia which could result in a universal war between poor and rich nations

results.title: The Sevens Tournament Quick! Quick! Quick!
results.brief_description: Teams from 16 countries including such unlikely contesters as West Samoa, Spain, USA, Japan, South Korea, Holland, Tonga, Romania and Canada, as well as England, Wales, France, Argentina, Fiji, New Zealand and Australia fight it out for the inaugural title. Rated: G

results.title: The Seven Faces of Dr Lao
results.creator_credit: George Pal, George Pal Productions and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Tony Randall plays seven fantastic and magical characters in this imaginative film based on the novel, “The circus of Dr. Lao”, by Charles G. Finney. A mysterious Chinese gentleman, Dr Lao, rides into the western desert town of Abalone. There he sets up a circus in which the townspeople are confronted by physical manifestations of their own fears and desires. With the arrival of Dr Lao the people of Abalone are to change forever. Randall is excellent in all his roles. The film also stars Barbara Eden.

results.creator_credit: Gateway Educational Films and Indiana University. Audio Visual Center

results.title: The Senses
results.creator_credit: Gabor Kalman and Sigma Educational Films
results.brief_description: Hearing, seeing, tasting, smelling, and touching are senses which help animals and birds to know their world. Young children are encouraged to use their senses to enrich the experience of their own environment.

results.title: The Senior service
results.brief_description: Photographed aboard the training ship, HMAS Australia, the film illustrates how young recruits are receiving practical instruction in technical trades and seamanship, preparing them for a career of travel and adventure in the Royal Australian Navy. The action of the film culminates in exercises, staged off the Tasmanian coast, in which naval forces from different parts of the British Commonwealth took part.

results.title: The Selfish giant
results.creator_credit: Murray Shostak, Peter Sander, Reiner Film and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Animated interpretation of Oscar Wilde’s allegory about selfishness, sharing and love. A beautiful garden is beset by perpetual winter after a greedy giant forbids children to play there. Then he is compelled to help a mysterious child who enters the garden and spring comes. At his life’s end the giant is led to another garden by this child.

results.title: The Segovia Master Class in Spain
results.creator_credit: Nathan Kroll and National Educational Television
results.brief_description: Part of the “Library of Master Performers” series. Instructional video featuring one of the world’s finest classical Spanish guitarists, Andres Segovia, as he performs and teaches students at the Santiago de Compostela in Spain. First he works with Aldo Minella (from Italy) on the Concerto in D for guitar, first movement by M. Castelnuovo-Tedesco and then with Luis Rodrigo (from Spain) with the piece Tarantella also by M. Castelnuovo-Tedesco.
